sentences.english: Hundreds of people have been killed in a stampede during a Shi'ite religious ceremony in Baghdad.
sentences.chinese: 数百人死于挤踏在巴格达稀客人的宗教庆典期间。

sentences.english: Oh, Mr. Johnson. You are quite a special guest.
sentences.chinese: 噢，是约翰逊先生，真是稀客。

definition: we are honored by your presence
(literary) I trust you have been well since we last met

pinyin: ren2 sheng1 he2 chu4 bu4 xiang1 feng2

definition: (polite) excuse me for not going out to meet you
I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)
lit. One doesn't visit a temple without a cause. (idiom)/fig. to visit sb with an ulterior motive (esp. to ask for sth)/having a hidden agenda
pinyin: wu2 shi4 bu4 deng1 san1 bao3 dian4

definition: Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling/see also 蓬蓽生光|蓬荜生光[peng2 bi4 sheng1 guang1]
see 貴人多忘|贵人多忘[gui4 ren2 duo1 wang4]
to turn up without being invited/unsolicited
failure to meet/(humble language) I'm sorry not to have come to meet you personally
honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
